Text:
That's right, if you walk down this road, you'll find
Mitsugoshi's main branch—they're this store that's
really taking off right now. They have all sorts of
rare items you can't find in other stores.
Wow...

Hey, I'm doing you a favor by starting a conversation
topic. At least try to act interested.

This is a date, after all. Why don't you try starting
a conversation for once, Pooch?

That's easy for you to say...but the worlds we live
in are so different, I doubt we have any common
ground to talk about.
Well, it's your job to find a way to make it work—

As if cutting off Alexia's words mid-sentence, several
men walk out of an alley, stopping the two of them in
their tracks.
Who are these men? Hey, Pooch, friends of yours?
I don't think any of my friends look that sketchy...

Could they be the people who I felt staring at us all
day? Wait...are they hardcore Alexia fans?

Yeahhh, they're Alexia-groupies. Everyone has their
weird kinks, I guess.
What are you mumbling on about?
Oh! Just monologuing. Don't worry about it.

We're possibly in trouble and you just say things
like that—I admire your audacity.

The men in front of them clearly have malicious
intentions—they aren't even trying to hide it.

You don't look very friendly, but I'll ask you this
question in good faith—do you have business with
us?
Princess Alexia, right?
Oh, so you're stalking me knowing full well who I am.

Just keep ya mouth shut and come with us. We don't
want things to get crazy here.

A man who seems to be the leader of the pack reached
out to grab Alexia's arm.
Alexia sweeps it away with her hand.
Oof!
Could you keep your filthy hands off me?

I didn't wanna go rough on ya, but if you're gonna
play tough, then ya leaving me no choice.

Oh, wow. Rather bold assertations for someone who
knows I'm a princess.

You're easier to catch than your big sis, at least.
Got a name for ya down our way..."Amateur Sword."
Oof!

My dear sir... If you anger me, you'll dearly regret
it. I may be an amateur, but I'm still strong enough
to kick all your asses!
Oh? Well then, with pleasure—
K-Keep your filthy ha-ha-ha-hands off...my pwinshesh!
Cid suddenly lunges in front of Alexia.

Pooch! What do you think you're doing?! Out of my
way.

(What's his deal? Trying to be a hero? But what good
is a weak-kneed idiot like him in a fight...)

Huh? What's your deal, kid? Trying to be a brave
knight protecting his little princess? Hehehe...
Your legs are shaking, buddy.

You're a waste of space. Unless ya wanna get hurt,
stay out of this!
E-Eeeep! I'm sorrwwy!

I tried to put my body on the line to protect my
princess, but reality bites. I am but a humble,
harmless passerby...! Have mercy!

Hah! We barely yelled at him and he messed his pants!
Serves ya right for trying to impress a girl. What a
loser! Hahahaha!

(They're right. You should stay out of the way. I'll
take care of these jerks.)
Now. Get moving, Prin—
I said...keep your filthy hands off me!
What did I tell you!

The moment he grabs her arm, the man's body
twists around and smashes to the ground.
Ooh, splendid move! Ten out of ten.
Pooch. This's no time to cheer.

It seems like these gentlemen aren't going to let us
go quietly.

O...Of c-c-c-course we ain't! We can't tell the boss
a little girl outsmarted us—the shame would kill us!

Hear that, Pooch? Well, I'd like to protect you, but
we're outnumbered.

Sorry, but we don't have much wiggle-room...probably.
So look for an opening and run for it.
Nooo! I can't look for an opening...I can't dooo it...

Stop whining! What happened to the guy who tried to
protect me just now? It's time to let that inertia fly.
B-But my body just moved on its own earlier...

Don't worry. They seem to only be after me. They'll
probably let you run away.
Y-You r-really think I'll be okay...?
I'm going in. Pooch...run for it!
Uh! Uh!
What are you doing?! Don't sit down—get out of here now!
My...my back...I can't walk...

Ohh...right. Jeez, why does your back give out at the
worst times!

Well, I'm partly at fault for forgetting about that...
It seems like I'm not calm enough to make decisions.

(There are three men—at least from what I can see. If
they have backup, I'm overwhelmingly outnumbered.
And on top of that, I have to protect Pooch...while I
fight? Impossible, no matter how you stretch it.)
(So...should I bail on him?)
P-Pwinshesh...

Stop whimpering! Jeez...if you give me puppy dog eyes
like that, there's no way I can abandon you.

Even if the odds are against me...I've got to at
least try.

(If we're loud enough, we might attract the attention
of some guards nearby.)

(Wow...it's not like me to leave things up to chance
like that. So, I'm gonna make my own way!)
Alexia steps forward and draws her sword.

Ooh, look at the pretty sword. You reckon you can
take us on your lonesome? In that case...since
weren't ordered to bring you back in one piece,
we might as well rough ya up a little.

We won't go easy on ya just because you're a little
girl.

Humph! Right back at you, little boys. I don't know
who you are, but you dared turn your swords on me—
And you'll regret that dearly!

First strike! I'm two steps ahead of you—you'll never
defeat me!
